main event: An airline pilot sighted a bright light near the Tulsa Airport in Oklahoma on October 23, 1954.
interesting points: The object was about the size of a small fighter plane, had a half-moon shape, and made no noise, smoke, or vapor.
The pilot estimated the object was 2-3 miles away at an altitude of around 2,500 feet.
Several civilian witnesses also reported seeing the bright light in the area.
The object was not detected on radar, and there was no unusual static or radio interference reported.
Weather conditions at the time included southwest winds of 20 knots, broken cloud cover at 9,220 feet, and 7 miles of visibility.
sighted object: a bright light, about the size of a small fighter plane, with a half-moon shape
witnesses: an airline pilot, several civilian witnesses
